oracle.kubernetes.weblogic.domain.v1

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.kubernetes.weblogic.domain.v1.Server
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClusteredServer, NonClusteredServer

    public class Server
extends Object
    Server describes the desired state of a server.

    • Method Detail

      • getStartedServerState

        public String getStartedServerState()
        The state the server should be started in when the server needs to be started. Legal values are RUNNING and ADMIN.

        Defaults to RUNNING.

        Returns:
        started server state

      • setStartedServerState

        public void setStartedServerState(String startedServerState)
        The state the server should be started in when the server needs to be started. Legal values are RUNNING and ADMIN.

        Defaults to RUNNING.

        Parameters:
        startedServerState - started server state

      • withStartedServerState

        The state the server should be started in when the server needs to be started. Legal values are RUNNING and ADMIN.

        Defaults to RUNNING.

      • getNodePort

        public Integer getNodePort()
        The port on each node on which this managed server will be exposed. If specified, this value must be an unused port.

        By default, the server will not be exposed outside the Kubernetes cluster.

        Returns:
        node port

      • setNodePort

        public void setNodePort(Integer nodePort)
        The port on each node on which this managed server will be exposed. If specified, this value must be an unused port.

        By default, the server will not be exposed outside the Kubernetes cluster.

        Parameters:
        nodePort - node port

      • withNodePort

      • getEnv

        public List<io.kubernetes.client.models.V1EnvVar> getEnv()
        Environment variables to pass while starting this server.

        If not specified, then the environment variables in config.xml will be used instead.

      • getImagePullPolicy

        public String getImagePullPolicy()
        The image pull policy for the WebLogic Docker image. Legal values are Always, Never and IfNotPresent.

        Defaults to Always if image ends in :latest, IfNotPresent otherwise.

        More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images#updating-images

        Returns:
        image pull policy

      • setImagePullPolicy

        public void setImagePullPolicy(String imagePullPolicy)
        The image pull policy for the WebLogic Docker image. Legal values are Always, Never and IfNotPresent.

        Defaults to Always if image ends in :latest, IfNotPresent otherwise.

        More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images#updating-images

        Parameters:
        imagePullPolicy - image pull policy

      • withImagePullPolicy

        public Server withImagePullPolicy(String imagePullPolicy)
        The image pull policy for the WebLogic Docker image. Legal values are Always, Never and IfNotPresent.

        Defaults to Always if image ends in :latest, IfNotPresent otherwise.

        More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images#updating-images

        Parameters:

      • getShutdownPolicy

        public String getShutdownPolicy()
        Controls how the operator will stop this server. Legal values are GRACEFUL_SHUTDOWN and FORCED_SHUTDOWN.

        Defaults to FORCED_SHUTDOWN.

        Returns:
        shutdown policy

      • setShutdownPolicy

        public void setShutdownPolicy(String shutdownPolicy)
        Controls how the operator will stop this server. Legal values are GRACEFUL_SHUTDOWN and FORCED_SHUTDOWN.

        Defaults to FORCED_SHUTDOWN.

        Parameters:
        shutdownPolicy - shutdown policy

      • getGracefulShutdownTimeout

        public Integer getGracefulShutdownTimeout()
        Number of seconds to wait before aborting inflight work and gracefully shutting down the server.

        Defaults to 0.

        Returns:
        graceful shutdown timeout
